abstract: New York City announces plans to permanently close to vehicular traffic stretches of north and southbound roads above 72nd Street in Central Park; closures are attempt to protect park's bikers, joggers, bird-watchers and pedestrians as well as cut air pollution in park.
lead_paragraph: In an effort to protect the park’s bikers, joggers, bird-watchers and pedestrians, as well as limit air pollution, the city will shut the miles of north and southbound drives that sprawl along the parkland above 72nd Street.

headline.main: End of a Pastoral Shortcut for Central Park’s Drivers
headline.print_headline: End of a Pastoral Shortcut for Central Park’s Drivers

snippet: In an effort to protect the park’s bikers, joggers, bird-watchers and pedestrians, as well as limit air pollution, the city will shut the miles of north and southbound drives that sprawl along the parkland above 72nd Street.
